main_definition: To stop doing something or to give up a particular activity, task, or behavior.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To cease an action or work in progress
meanings_and_examples.example: After realizing the project's goals were not achievable, she decided to quit working on it.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Ending a job or employment status
meanings_and_examples.example: He submitted his resignation letter and formally quit his position at the company.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To stop using a substance, usually in the context of addiction recovery
meanings_and_examples.example: After years of smoking cigarettes, he finally decided to quit for good.
She had to quit her seat on the crowded bus as there were no more available spaces.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To stop participating in an activity, sport, or game
meanings_and_examples.example: He decided to quit basketball after he suffered a severe injury during practice.
